item.title: Combat level?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

In you’re client class, add this, public int getCombatLevel() { int mag = (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[6])) * 1.5); int ran = (int) ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[4])) * 1.5); int attstr = (int) ((double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])) + (double) (getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]))); if (ran > attstr) { combatLevel = (int) (((getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[4])) * 0.4875)); } else if (mag > attstr) { combatLevel = (int) (((getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[6])) * 0.4875)); } else { combatLevel = (int) (((getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])) * 0.25) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])) * 0.125) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])) * 0.325) + ((getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])) * 0.325)); } return combatLevel; }
then under you’re initialize method, add this,

Post errors.
